duties_responsibilities.duty: Monitor and maintain the organization's local area network (LAN), wide area network (WAN), and internet connectivity to ensure optimal performance and uptime.

Implement and manage network security measures to protect against unauthorized access, data breaches, and cyber threats. This includes configuring firewalls, VPNs, and intrusion detection/prevention systems.
Diagnose and resolve network-related issues, such as connectivity problems, network outages, and performance bottlenecks.
Plan and execute network upgrades and expansions to accommodate the organization's growth and changing requirements.
Configure and manage network devices, including routers, switches, access points, and other networking equipment.
Perform regular maintenance tasks such as system updates, patches, and upgrades to keep the infrastructure up-to-date and secure.
Manage and configure servers, both physical and virtual, to ensure optimal performance and resource utilization.
Install, configure, and troubleshoot operating systems, such as Windows Server, Linux, or other specialized systems, depending on the organization's needs.
Create and manage user accounts and access permissions to various systems and applications.
Implement and maintain security measures to protect systems from unauthorized access, viruses, malware, and other security threats.
Set up and manage data backup and recovery solutions to ensure data integrity and availability in case of system failures or disasters.
Configure and maintain network services, including DNS, DHCP, VPN, and other services required for network functionality.
Diagnose and resolve hardware and software issues for both servers and end-user systems.
Use monitoring tools to proactively identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, system errors, and other issues.
Maintain comprehensive system documentation, including configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides.
Ensure compliance with IT policies, procedures, and industry standards, such as data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and IT security best practices.
Respond to and address system-related incidents and outages promptly and effectively.
Work with other IT teams and departments to support various projects and integrate systems and services.
Special projects as requested.
Performs other duties as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in IT preferred. Equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
Has between 6-10 years of proven working experience as a System Administrator/Network Engineer.
Relevant certifications like Microsoft Certified System Administrator (MCSA), CompTIA Server+, or Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA) preferred.
Strong knowledge of operating systems, server hardware, and system administration tools.
Familiarity with networking concepts, protocols, and services.
Understanding of virtualization technologies and cloud computing.
Security-focused mindset and knowledge of IT security best practices.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to troubleshoot complex technical issues.
Effective communication and teamwork skills to collaborate with colleagues and end-users.

The specific responsibilities and requirements for a System Administrator may vary based on the organization's size, industry, and complexity of its IT infrastructure. In some cases, a System Administrator's role may overlap with other IT roles, such as Network Administrator or Database Administrator, depending on the organization's IT structure.
